snippet: Critics of Gov. Scott Walker say he is capitalizing on a view that is popular among conservatives like those in the Iowa caucuses: that state universities are elite bastions of liberal academics.
abstract: Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker's proposed budget cuts to state's public university system, as well as changes to University of Wisconsin's mission statement, are widely seen by residents as appeals to conservative voters in advance of his likely 2016 Republican presidential bid; cuts appear to fit with popular conservative view that state universities are breeding ground for elite liberal academics and do not prepare students for workforce.
lead_paragraph: Critics of Gov. Scott Walker say he is capitalizing on a view that is popular among conservatives like those in the Iowa caucuses: that state universities are elite bastions of liberal academics.

headline.seo: Gov. Scott Walker’s Higher Education Budget Ignites Backlash
headline.main: 2016 Ambitions Seen in Walker’s Push for University Cuts in Wisconsin
headline.print_headline: 2016 Ambitions Seen in Bid for Wisconsin Cuts
